Issues.Body:

## What is the current behavior?
<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Link in the [app shell docs page](https://angular.dev/ecosystem/service-workers/app-shell) about app shell pattern points to https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/architecture/app-shell

> The [App shell pattern](https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/architecture/app-shell) is a way to render a portion of your application [...]

However that URL redirects to 
https://web.dev/learn/pwa/architecture/

> [Since some point between Apr 9th -> June 9th 2022 according to the Wayback Machine](https://web.archive.org/web/changes/https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/architecture/app-shell) 

**Which is not very related to the app shell model**

The link previously pointed to an article about the app shell model:

https://web.archive.org/web/20220409043508/https://developers.google.com/web/fundamentals/architecture/app-shell

Which currently is live with almost same content at
https://developer.chrome.com/blog/app-shell

Also the same link is repeated twice, which I think is verbose IMO

Issue Number: N/A


## What is the new behavior?

Point to the original article

Remove the extra duplicate reference

- [ ] Yes

Issues.Title: Feature request: Enhanced Control and Feedback for Service Worker Registration and Caching
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Description

Currently, the Angular service worker does not provide adequate control and feedback mechanisms during the registration and caching process. This can lead to issues where developers are unable to detect if the service worker registration has failed or if the caching process has been successfully completed.
Example, right now I am unable to detect if the service worker registration failed. After inspection I found out that the `navigator.serviceworker.register` code is present in main.js file generated after production build. The catch handler attached to the returned promise just consoles the error. 
Also, there is no feedback about the caching of assets. The service worker is installed even if any asset could not be cached but some use cases might things to be handled a little differently.

### Describe the solution you'd like

The `ServiceWorker `module could provide some observables which emit such errors and feedback for registration failure, successful caching etc., 
Also more control over caching should be present because for some applications which are fully offline might require that all assets be cached before the Service worker installation is deemed successful. 

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Tried using the observables provided by SwUpdate service but realized that they don't work for the initial registration. 
Tried using navigator.serviceworker.ready promise but this promise never rejects and will wait indefinitely to resolve until some SW is registered.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Feature request: Enhanced Control and Feedback for Service Worker Registration and Caching" (#57159)

Issues.Title: refactor(core): Private option to rethrow ApplicationRef.tick errors in tests
Issues.Body:
This creates a private option that can be used internally while we              
migrate this to the default and only behavior. ~200 tests in TGP have errors       
that are being swallowed (console.log) and not causing the test to fail.        
We can first explicitly opt those out, flip the default internally, then        
"fix" them by adding expect...toThrow.   

First commit is in #56993
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "refactor(core): Private option to rethrow ApplicationRef.tick errors in tests                                                                                                              " (#57153)

Issues.Title: Router Outlet adds component after the current component
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

router

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

I'm using standalone components, and a custom layout, so I have to router outlets, one in app.component.html and one on the custom layout component (core-ui-admin-layout.component.html).

When I enter on the app, it redirects to localhost:4200/dashboard, and the component is loaded correctly. If I click on the left menu to go to Graph, it loads the second component below the dashboard component.

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://stackblitz.com/~/github.com/bruno-lopes/router-outlet-problem

### Please provide the exception or error you saw

```true
The second component is loaded below the first component.
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
Angular CLI: 18.1.2
Node: 18.20.0
Package Manager: npm 10.5.0
OS: linux x64

Angular: 18.1.2
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, language-service, material, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, platform-server, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1801.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            18.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.1.2
@schematics/angular             18.1.2
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.4
zone.js                         0.14.8
```


### Anything else?

Also, in dashboard, if I click on the "child works!" text, it activates a IF on the child component, and show some info. If I click "child works!" again, it deactivates the if, but the info is not hidden. If I click a third time on "child works!" text, the info is showed below the first info.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Router Outlet adds component after the current component" (#57151)

This update bumps the Scorecard version to the v5 release. For a complete list of changes, please refer to the [v5.0.0 release notes](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard/releases/tag/v5.0.0). Issues.Title: `ngtypecheck` reference added in compiled TS files for libraries with multiple secondary entrypoints
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

compiler-cli

### Is this a regression?

No

### Description

> See [related issue]

After upgrading to Angular v18.1.0, built Typescript definition files `*.d.ts` include a reference to `ngtypecheck.d.ts` files at the top of those. For instance:

```
/// <reference path="index.ngtypecheck.d.ts" />
```

Seems this only appears for [secondary entrypoints](https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/blob/18.1.0/docs/secondary-entrypoints.md) of libraries though. 

This is not an issue when building if you have `skipLibCheck: true` in `tsconfig.json`. Which [was introduced in Angular CLI v17.1 AFAIK](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/e2f92ab957e797d8085616fcdea0b73344e614af). However, those references point to missing files, so they're not valid anyway.

If coming from a workspace pre v17.1, that option isn't there and `ng build` fails (see below).


[related issue]: https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/56945

### Please provide a link to a minimal reproduction of the bug

https://github.com/davidlj95/angular-18.1-typecheck-libs-error

### Please provide the exception or error you saw


```
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Building entry point 'example/tertiary-entrypoint'
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
âœ– Compiling with Angular sources in Ivy partial compilation mode.
dist/example/secondary-entrypoint/index.d.ts:1:22 - error TS6053: File '/Users/davidlj95/Code/git/tmp/angular-18.1-typecheck-libs-error/dist/example/secondary-entrypoint/index.ngtypecheck.d.ts' not found.

1 /// <reference path="index.ngtypecheck.d.ts" />
                       ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
```


### Please provide the environment you discovered this bug in (run `ng version`)

```true
     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / â–³ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/
    

Angular CLI: 18.1.2
Node: 20.12.0
Package Manager: pnpm 9.6.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 18.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1801.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            18.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.1.2
@schematics/angular             18.1.2
ng-packagr                      18.1.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.4.5
zone.js                         0.14.8
```


### Anything else?

The [fix](https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/56961) for the [related issue] was shipped in [Angular v18.1.1](https://github.com/angular/angular/releases/tag/18.1.1). Used that version to generate the minimal reproduction repository, but the issue is still there.

If upgrading Typescript to 5.5.x as mentioned in the [related issue], the issue goes away (no reference in definition files).

If downgrading `ng-packagr` to `18.0.0`, issue is still there
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "`ngtypecheck` reference added in compiled TS files for libraries with multiple secondary entrypoints" (#57135)

Issues.Title: Allow NgOptimizedImage to work with predefined srcset
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? common ### Description Currently, if I have a predefined srcset and do not need srcset autogeneration, I cannot use that predefined srcset with NgOptimizedImage. This is particularly useful when image links are signed and returned by the backend server, rather than being generated on the frontend. Example of the predefined srcset: ``` https://images.com/signature/image.png/128 128w, https://images.com/signature/image.png/256 256w, https://images.com/signature/image.png/384 384w ``` The `ngSrcset` does not support a complete srcset with image links, it only supports a comma-separated list of one or more width/density descriptors. The issue is that while I can add `[attr.srcset]` for the image, NgOptimizedImage won't be able to work with it. For instance, if I have an image marked with `priority`, NgOptimizedImage will autogenerate preload link element without `imagesrcset`, basically omitting `[attr.srcset]`. It seems that it generates `imagesrcset` only when `ngSrcset` is used, which prevents the use of NgOptimizedImage with predefined srcset values. ### Proposed solution Allow NgOptimizedImage to work with `[attr.srcset]` or add support for NgOptimizedImage to be able to use predefined srcset within `ngSrcset`. Along the lines of: ``` ``` where `image.srcset` is just a string of ``` https://images.com/signature/image.png/128 128w, https://images.com/signature/image.png/256 256w, https://images.com/signature/image.png/384 384w ``` ### Alternatives considered To make it work right now, I had to come up with a custom image loader and a bunch of utility functions. With `image.srcset` defined as ``` srcset: { [key: string]: string; }; // key is image width, value is an image src ``` I have the following `` ``` ``` ``` export function getSrcSet(srcset: { [key: string]: string }): string { return Object.keys(srcset).map(key => key + 'w').join(', ') } ``` And this sort of custom image loader ``` export const predefinedSrcsetImageLoader: ImageLoader = (config: ImageLoaderConfig): string => { if (config.loaderParams?.['srcset'] && config.width) { let srcset: { [key: string]: string } = config.loaderParams?.['srcset']; return srcset[config.width]; } else { return config.src; } } ``` While this approach works, it requires additional effort and complexity that could be avoided with better support for predefined srcset values in NgOptimizedImage.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Allow NgOptimizedImage to work with predefined srcset" (#57145)

Issues.Title: Wrong warning about not animatable properties
Issues.Body:
### Which @angular/* package(s) are the source of the bug?

animations

### Is this a regression?

Yes

### Description

In some situations, using an non-animatable property in a transition within a non-animated "style" step shows a (wrong) developer warning. See reproduction.

```ts
trigger('animationHeightInOutSymmetric', [
      transition(':enter', [
        style({height: 0, overflow: 'hidden'}),
        animate(`300ms ease-in-out`, style({height: '*'})),
        style({overflow: '*'})
      ])
    ])
```

```true
(to check the list of all animatable properties visit https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/CSS_animated_properties)
```

Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

Currently the migration updates:

```ts
constructor(@Inject(LOCALE_ID) locale: string) {
  console.log({ locale });
}
```

to:

```ts
constructor() {
  console.log({ locale });
}
```

## What is the new behavior?

This fixes the migration, and results in:

```
constructor() {
  const locale = inject(LOCALE_ID);
  console.log({ locale });
}
```


## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No


<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>webpack-contrib/sass-loader (sass-loader)</summary>

### [`v16.0.0`](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/releases/tag/v16.0.0)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/compare/v15.0.0...v16.0.0)

##### âš  BREAKING CHANGES

-   use modern Sass JS API by default for `sass` and `sass-embedded`

> \[!WARNING]
>
> The sass options are different for the `legacy` (before) and `modern` APIs. Please look at [docs](https://sass-lang.com/documentation/js-api) how to migrate to the modern options.
> Legacy options - https://sass-lang.com/documentation/js-api/interfaces/legacystringoptions/
> Modern options - https://sass-lang.com/documentation/js-api/interfaces/options/

To return to the previous logic use:

```js
module.exports = {
  module: {
    rules: [
      {
        test: /\.s[ac]ss$/i,
        use: [
          "style-loader",
          "css-loader",
          {
            loader: "sass-loader",
            options: {
              api: "legacy",
              // Your options
            },
          },
        ],
      },
    ],
  },
};
```

##### Features

-   use modern Sass JS API by default for `sass` and `sass-embedded` ([10be1ba](https://togithub.com/webpack-contrib/sass-loader/commit/10be1ba161557638fd3b80f4a5467159179ef9b1))

</details>

#### What's Changed

This update bumps the Scorecard version to the v5 release. For a complete list of changes, please refer to the [v5.0.0 release notes](https://togithub.com/ossf/scorecard/releases/tag/v5.0.0). Alerts will not be generated for any Scorecard Check with an annotation.

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): prevent build failures with remote CSS imports when Tailwind is configured
Issues.Body:
This addresses a bug where `@import url()` statements with remote CSS files (ending in .css) caused build errors when Tailwind was present. The issue arised from incorrect handling of remote URLs by the stylesheet plugin, which treated them as local files. This fix ensures proper handling of remote CSS imports.

Closes #28113
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/build): prevent build failures with remote CSS imports when Tailwind is configured" (#28116)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): resolve error with `extract-i18n` builder for libraries
Issues.Body:
The `extract-i18n` builder is only intended to be used with application projects.

Closes #28109
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/build): resolve error with `extract-i18n` builder for libraries" (#28115)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular/build): add CSP `nonce` attribute to script tags when inline critical CSS is disabled
Issues.Body:
Prior to this change when inline critical CSS is disabled CSP `nonce` was not added to script tags.

Closes #28102
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular/build): add CSP `nonce` attribute to script tags when inline critical CSS is disabled" (#28114)

Issues.Title: esbuild: Using Tailwind breaks stylesheet processing for CSS @imports with URLs ending in .css
Issues.Body:
### Command

build

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When Tailwind is configured in a project (maybe just PostCSS), any `@import url()` statement with a URL ending in `.css` (such as `@import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/earlyaccess/notokufiarabic.css);` causes the build to fail, as the url is deemed a local file by the language filters passed to [`StyleSheetPluginFactory.create()`](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/048df34ccb7d4ef67b5877e126c74c0db65b879c/packages/angular/build/src/tools/esbuild/stylesheets/bundle-options.ts#L59-L61). The `create` method seems to register an esbuild `onLoad` handler that will [read the path as a local file](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/048df34ccb7d4ef67b5877e126c74c0db65b879c/packages/angular/build/src/tools/esbuild/stylesheets/stylesheet-plugin-factory.ts#L167-L170)

Any URLs ending in `.less`, `.scss` or `.sass` are also affected.

In our case we can't easily remove `.css` from the imported URL, as it's defined by an imported third party CSS file.

### Minimal Reproduction

1. Create a new project with `ng new`
2. Install Tailwind by following the [Tailwind + Angular installation guide](https://tailwindcss.com/docs/guides/angular)
3. Add the following to `src/styles.css`: `@import url(https://fonts.googleapis.com/earlyaccess/notokufiarabic.css);`
4. Run `npm run build`
5. The build fails, as the URL is attemped to be read as a local file

When no Tailwind config file is present, the build runs fine:
1. Remove `tailwind.config.js` and the `@tailwind` lines from the CSS file, while keeping the `@import url()`
2. Run `npm run build`
3. The build succeeds

### Exception or Error

```text
ENOENT: no such file or directory, open 'https://fonts.googleapis.com/earlyaccess/notokufiarabic.css' [plugin angular-css]
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 18.1.2
Node: 20.14.0
Package Manager: npm 10.7.0
OS: darwin arm64

Angular: 18.1.2
... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1801.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            18.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.1.2
@schematics/angular             18.1.2
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.4
zone.js                         0.14.8
```


### Anything else relevant?

_No response_

Issues.Title: Path[1] argument must be of type string. Received undefined
Issues.Body:
### Command

extract-i18n

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

I have been trying to export the i18n information from a part of our code, previously this code was in our project as components.
Now I want to create a library out of it and the actual building and using it in the project as a package works but when exporting with `ng extract-i18n --project <projectNameHere>` I keep getting the error from the title: 

> An unhandled exception occurred: The "paths[1]" argument must be of type string. Received undefined

In debugging the offending line and file I've found that the actual object used in this process has the `path` variable but it's an object.

Changing this to an array or just a string does not resolve the issue and even breaks the actual build of the library.

I've reproduced this in a brand new project and still the same error.

### Minimal Reproduction

Create a new workspace, add a library and try to extract localization info

- ng new company.Angular.Components --no-create-application
- cd .\company.Angular.Components\  
- ng generate library @company/angular-lib-forms 
- ng add @angular/localize
- ng extract-i18n --project @company/angular-lib-forms

### Exception or Error

```text
[error] TypeError [ERR_INVALID_ARG_TYPE]: The "paths[1]" argument must be of type string. Received undefined
    at Object.resolve (node:path:171:9)

    at getCommonConfig (C:\Users\<username>\Desktop\Projects\<projectname>\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\tools\webpack\configs\common.js:275:24)

    at async Promise.all (index 2)

    at async generateWebpackConfig (C:\Users\<username>\Desktop\Projects\<projectname>\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\utils\webpack-browser-config.js:64:22)

    at async generateBrowserWebpackConfigFromContext (C:\Users\<username>\Desktop\Projects\<projectname>\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\utils\webpack-browser-config.js:119:20)

    at async extractMessages (C:\Users\<username>\Desktop\Projects\<projectname>\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\builders\extract-i18n\webpack-extraction.js:52:24)

    at async execute (C:\Users\<username>\Desktop\Projects\<projectname>\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\builders\extract-i18n\builder.js:84:28)
```


### Your Environment

```text
Angular CLI: 18.1.2
Node: 20.15.0
Package Manager: npm 10.7.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 18.1.1
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... localize, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1801.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            18.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.1.2
@angular/cli                    18.1.2
@schematics/angular             18.1.2
ng-packagr                      18.1.0
rxjs                            7.8.1
typescript                      5.5.4
zone.js                         0.14.8
```

Issues.Title: ng-elements(runtime exception): build-angular:application + optimization: true
Issues.Body: ### Command build / core / zone.js ### Description Hey! I'm (with my team) in the process of migrating a huge enterprise micro frontend based app to the new esbuild build stack. But, I'm facing some runtime issues that I'm not really able to flag as "internal problems" or "angular issues". So: either I'm doing something really stupid (then sorry for the waste of time) or there is a bug at angular level. At the moment, I'm mostly inclined to think it's an angular issue related to the usage of "ng-modules" / "zone.js" and the way esbuild is striping the bundle from unnecessary code as soon as `optimization: true` (default). To reproduce the issue, I've created a simple angular project ([myws](https://github.com/mauriziocescon/myws/tree/master)) that you can fork and play with. It's a tiny and simplified version of what we're doing in our CI/CD. Here is a summary of the process: - build an ng-element (with ng-modules / zone.js) as an application, - concatenate the resulting files in one main.js, - load such files at runtime. As you can see in the repo, the results are the following: - mf1 (âœ…): built with `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:browser"`, `"buildOptimizer": true`, - mf2 (âœ…): built with `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application"`, `"optimization": false`, - mf3 (ðŸš«): built with `"builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:application"`, `"optimization": true`. where mf1 / mf2 / mf3 have basically the same code. The runtime error for mf3 is not really helpful: Locally, I get different errors for different internal mfs, but I assume the root cause is the same. Some examples: I hope there's enough information to the make the ticket actionable on your side! Otherwise, feel free to request whatever makes more sense for you. Thanks a lot! ### Minimal Reproduction https://github.com/mauriziocescon/myws/tree/master ### Your Environment ```text 18.1.1 ```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ng-elements(runtime exception): build-angular:application + optimization: true" (#28101)

build

I want to implement strict CSP policy for my project, so replaced unsafe-eval and unsafe-inline with nonce-dynamicnonce.

Issues.Title: BUILD: Changes to local repo's build system(path to npm_package_archive.tgz files)
Issues.Body:
Fixes the paths to npm_package_archive.tgz on local builds

## PR Checklist

Please check to confirm your PR fulfills the following requirements:

<!-- Please check all that apply using "x". -->

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines
- [ ] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)

## PR Type

What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [x] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:

## What is the current behavior?
I have followed the documentation steps mentioned in [Developer.md](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/main/docs/DEVELOPER.md). After running `yarn build --local` the package.json file for every scope(i.e. cli, build, pwa, etc..) have incorrect paths to npm_package_archive.tgz

Steps to reproduce
1. Clone the [angular cli repository](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli). 
2. Run `yarn build --local`
3. Open the dist folder and extract _angular_cli.tgz (Using this as an example you can look for any other tgz file in dist)
4. Open the `package.json` file
5. Look for `@angular-devkit/architect` (Using this as an example)
6. You will observe that the path to the file is something like: `<path>\packages\angular_devkit\npm_package_archive.tgz`
7. The same thing can be observerd in many places in this package.json file, and in other package.json files of other generated `<package>.tgz`



<!-- Please describe the current behavior that you are modifying, or link to a relevant issue. -->

Issue Number: N/A

## What is the new behavior?

Expected path(using `@angular-devkit/architect` as an example) should be `<path>/packages\angular_devkit\architect\npm_package_archive.tgz` 

<!-- Please describe the new behavior that. -->

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No
- [x] Maybe(As it is chaning the package.json files for local builds)

<!-- If this PR contains a breaking change, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications below. -->

## Other information

The problem seems to be in `link_package_json_to_tarballs.bzl` file where an unnecessary `dirname ` in line 56 is used ( this is resulting in `parent of parent dir` instead of just having `parent dir`). It is executing a statement like `(  dirname (<path>\packages\angular_devkit\architect)    )/npm_package_archive.tgz` which is resulting in TAR to have an incorrect value like `<path>\packages\angular_devkit\npm_package_archive.tgz`
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "BUILD: Changes to local repo's build system(path to npm_package_archive.tgz files)" (#28100)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-divider): Incorrect color token on Material 3 Theme
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [X] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

18.0.x

### Description

In Angular Material 18.1.x, when using a Material 3 theme, the `mat-divider` component uses the `outline` token instead of the `outline-variant` as specified by the Material 3 guidelines. This change caused sections in our application to appear more prominent than expected. Additionally, this creates inconsistency in places where we combine custom styles that set the color of outlines by using the `outline-variant` role from the theme, and also have `mat-dividers` within.

I understand that the change from #28995 is to achieve better color contrast. However, this deviates from the specification, which explains that dividers are decorative elements and have no minimum contrast requirements.

https://m3.material.io/components/divider/accessibility
https://m3.material.io/components/divider/specs#f7d1605e-1629-404c-86a5-0ef6848ce520
![image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/5161b955-a4ff-4cdc-9d09-d1b1ca807908)

A potential workaround can be to use the `--mat-divider-color` property and set color to the `outline-variant` token, but it would be nice if there is no need for style changes.

### Reproduction

StackBlitz links: 
- Angular Material **18.1.x**: https://stackblitz.com/edit/mwztdu?file=package.json
- Angular Material **18.0.x**: https://stackblitz.com/edit/mwztdu-iaag8z?file=package.json

Steps to reproduce:
1. Open the example using Angular Material 18.1.x. Observe that the dividers take their color from the `outline` token.
2. Open the example using Angular Material 18.0.x. Observe that the dividers take their color from the `outline-variant` token.


### Expected Behavior

Divider uses the `outline-variant` color token

### Actual Behavior

Divider uses the `outline` color token

### Environment

Angular CLI: 18.1.2
Node: 18.20.3
Package Manager: yarn 1.22.19
OS: linux x64

Angular: 18.1.2
... animations, cdk, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core
... forms, localize, material, material-experimental
... material-moment-adapter, platform-browser
... platform-browser-dynamic, router

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1801.2
@angular-devkit/build-angular   18.1.2
@angular-devkit/core            18.1.2
@angular-devkit/schematics      18.1.2
@schematics/angular             18.1.2
rxjs                            7.4.0
typescript                      5.4.5
zone.js                         0.14.6
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-divider): Incorrect color token on Material 3 Theme" (#29494)

### Description

The bug is reproducible both in mat-select and mat-autocomplete.

If I wrap the `mat-optgroup`'s content in `<ng-container *ngIf="...">`, the `mat-autocomplete` is rendered properly.

5. Wrap its immediate content with `@if(true) {...}` block
6. Check the autocomplete dropdown - all options are now narrower because they're rendered inside of the option group label's `span` element


### Expected Behavior

`mat-option` elements should be rendered after `span.mat-mdc-optgroup-label` as siblings.

### Actual Behavior

`mat-option` elements are rendered as descendants of `span.mat-mdc-optgroup-label`.

### Environment

Issues.Title: docs-bug(Accessibility): Clarifying Accessibility target in documentation
Issues.Body:
### Documentation Feedback

I'm evaluating component libraries to use in an enterprise app, and accessibility is a key consideration. Having looked through the documentation, I'm not able to find a specific target for Angular Material's accessibility. Would you all consider specifying which WCAG level you are targeting? PrimeNG specifically calls out that they meet the WCAG 2.1 AA standard. While Angular Material seems to put a lot of work into accessibility, it would be helpful to be able to state that the component library we use targets a specific WCAG level. 

### Affected documentation page

material.angular.io
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(Accessibility): Clarifying Accessibility target in documentation" (#29492)

Issues.Title: bug(slide-toggle): The button element contains div elements
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Button elements should contain only "[Phrasing content](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Content_categories#phrasing_content) but there must be no [Interactive content](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Content_categories#interactive_content)"

 `div`s should be replaced with `span` elements

### Actual Behavior

The button contains invalid elements

Issues.Title: Request for Number input text field or currency input text field in angular Material
Issues.Body: ### Which @angular/* package(s) are relevant/related to the feature request? _No response_ ### Description An input text field to accept only numbers, group separators and decimal separator according to the locale. We can easily use a decimal pipe or currency pipe to display formatted values in span like this {{num | decimal : locale}}, but when we try to format numbers inside input text field we encounter some challenges like comma separators, decimal separator and handling validations on those fields. ### Proposed solution An input text field to accept only numbers, group separators and decimal separator according to the locale. Requesting to add the above mentioned feature in angular Material. ### Alternatives considered Requesting for directives to handle above mentioned problems. Which will help so many developers.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Request for Number input text field or currency input text field in angular Material " (#29487)

Issues.Title: feat(MatTab): MatTabGroup
Issues.Body:
### Feature Description

According to the [Tabs Pattern](https://www.w3.org/WAI/ARIA/apg/patterns/tabs/), if the tab list has a visible label, the element with role tablist has `aria-labelledby` set to a value that refers to the labelling element. Otherwise, the tablist element has a label provided by `aria-label`.

MaTabGroup does not allow users to [provide an accessible label via `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby` for the element with role tablist](https://github.com/angular/components/blob/43c166c1efa882291140a0c958b8dbad4c0923fb/src/material/tabs/tab-header.html#L24).

### Use Case

Users of this component can provide a label through either `aria-label` or `aria-labelledby`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(MatTab): MatTabGroup" (#29486)

Issues.Title: bug(@angular/google-maps): Unable to preventDefault inside passive event listener invocation on <google-map>
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

When using the <google-map> component and scrolling over it, the inspector console shows the following error:

`main.js:138 Unable to preventDefault inside passive event listener invocation.`

This error occurs when zooming in or out on the map, making it impossible to hide the error. Additionally, it triggers the outer scroll, causing the entire window to scroll when interacting with the map, which is not user-friendly.

Attempts to Fix:
I have tried several methods to resolve this issue, but none have been successful:

	â€¢	Adding (wheel) or (scroll) events and using $event.preventDefault() results in the error being triggered twice.




### Reproduction

	1.	Integrate the <google-map> component into an Angular project.
	2.	Open the application in a browser.
	3.	Scroll over the map to zoom in or out.
	4.	Observe the error in the inspector console.

### Expected Behavior

	â€¢	No error should appear in the console when zooming in or out on the map.
	â€¢	Scrolling within the map should not trigger the outer window scroll.

### Actual Behavior

	â€¢	The error Unable to preventDefault inside passive event listener invocation. appears in the console.
	â€¢	Scrolling within the map also triggers the outer window scroll.

### Environment

	â€¢	Angular Version: 18.0.6
	â€¢	<google-map> Component Version: 18.1.2
	â€¢	Browser: Chrome
	â€¢	Operating System: Node v22.1.0, Mac
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "bug(@angular/google-maps): Unable to preventDefault inside passive event listener invocation on <google-map>" (#29482)

Issues.Title: bug(slide-toggle): Clicking on mat-slide-toggle element does not toggles the input, but sets :active pseudo selector visually indicating a click
Issues.Body:
### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this behavior used to work in the previous version

### The previous version in which this bug was not present was

_No response_

### Description

Slide toggle toggles it's value on `button` or `label` click only, but because of the `.mat-mdc-slide-toggle:active .mdc-switch:not(.mdc-switch--disabled) .mdc-switch__handle` selector clicking on the "container" of the button and label triggers visual press on the element.

### Reproduction

[StackBlitz link](https://stackblitz.com/edit/ksepw8?file=src%2Fexample%2Fslide-toggle-overview-example.ts)
Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on the `pink` area
2. The handle size changes without toggling the button.


### Expected Behavior

It should toggle the button or do not trigger the size change.

### Actual Behavior

It triggers the size change.

### Environment

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/drag-drop): not possible to use custom drag handle with mat table rows
Issues.Body:
### Description

CDK Drag and Drop allows to reorder rows within material table however it is not possible to restrict the reordering only using drag handle icon. 


### Reproduction

StackBlitz link: https://stackblitz.com/edit/vaeujs-yrvig8?file=src%2Fexample%2Fcdk-drag-drop-table-example.html
Steps to reproduce:
1. Open drag and drop on table rows example from here https://material.angular.io/cdk/drag-drop/examples#cdk-drag-drop-table
2. Add `cdkDragHandle` to first cell def `mat-icon`


### Expected Behavior

Row should only be dragged using the icon.

### Actual Behavior

Rows can be dragged from anywhere within that row.

### Environment

- Angular: 18.1
- CDK/Material: 18.1
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk/drag-drop): not possible to use custom drag handle with mat table rows" (#29475)

Issues.Title: build: docs incorrectly outputting function parameters with object literal type
Issues.Body:
We were extracting the type of a function parameter by splitting on `:` and taking the second item. The problem is that if the type is an object literal, it'll have more than one colon in its text.

These changes fix the issue by only looking for the first colon and extracting the name based on it.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: docs incorrectly outputting function parameters with object literal type" (#29471)
